intro: Eurystegia glauca, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, blue-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, producing clusters of small, pale blue to white florets. Eurystegia glauca is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and streambanks.
